criteria: Description of Impact of Environmental Issues
descriptions: The student does not identify any global environmental issues.
The student identifies one global environmental issue with significant inaccuracies.
The student identifies one global environmental issue with minor inaccuracies.
The student identifies two global environmental issues with some inaccuracies or lack of detail.
The student identifies three global environmental issues with reasonable accuracy and detail.
The student accurately identifies and describes three or more global environmental issues with supporting details and examples.
The student does not describe any impacts of environmental issues.
The student attempts to describe the impact of an environmental issue, but the description lacks clarity or accuracy.
The student describes the impact of one environmental issue with limited detail.
The student describes the impacts of two environmental issues with some detail.
The student describes the impacts of multiple environmental issues with reasonable detail and accuracy.
The student thoroughly and accurately describes the impacts of multiple environmental issues, demonstrating a strong understanding of their consequences.
The student does not discuss potential solutions to environmental issues.
The student mentions potential solutions but they are unrealistic or inappropriate.
The student suggests basic, common solutions with little explanation.
The student suggests feasible solutions to some issues with some explanation.
The student suggests feasible solutions to multiple issues with reasonable explanation and understanding.
The student provides well-reasoned and innovative solutions to multiple environmental issues, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding of their feasibility and impact.
